summary: Build a simple, clean, responsive Proposal Day single-page website with Hero, a polished animated vertical Timeline (rounded cards with date/title/1-line description), and an interactive Proposal section with animated text, Yes/No buttons, celebratory confetti/hearts on Yes, and playful escalating No-button messages with eventual random movement.
architectural_notes: Single-page responsive layout with sections: Hero, Timeline, Proposal
Romantic theme styling with lightweight animations; button click triggers celebration effect (hearts/confetti) and message
Timeline items include date, title, and 1-line description displayed in rounded cards within a vertical timeline layout
Use scroll-triggered soft fade/slide animations for timeline cards
Proposal section includes both Yes and No buttons; No button cycles through predefined messages per click and later moves randomly
Timeline layout/interaction should not rely on a vertical-scroll behavior the user dislikes (revise UX to an alternative presentation while keeping content accessible).
If using a horizontal/non-vertical timeline, include clear date/time labels and obvious navigation (arrows/dots/scroll hint) so users understand how to view all events.
known_issues: Proposal section: No button overlaps the Yes button.
Proposal section: The funny/escalating No-button message text is overlapping/misaligned (layout issue).
Timeline (revised horizontal/non-vertical layout): date/time and how to navigate the timeline are not clear to the user; needs clearer affordance/labels.

Implement the Hero section with a big romantic headline about the 5-year relationship and a short subtitle.
Implement the Timeline section that displays the provided relationship events in chronological order with date and label.
Implement the Proposal section with the exact proposal text and a prominent ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button.
Add a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button interaction that triggers a celebratory effect (hearts and/or confetti) and shows a celebration message.

Apply a romantic visual theme and basic animations across the page while keeping the overall design simple, clean, and functional. Use a cohesive palette (avoid blue/purple) and consistent typography, spacing, and component styling.
Update the Timeline section to use rounded timeline cards that display date, title, and a 1-line description for each timeline item, using the exact items and descriptions provided by the user.
Add a soft fade-in or slide-in animation that triggers when each Timeline card scrolls into view (not only on initial page load).
Update the Proposal section to include two buttons: ‚ÄúYes‚Äù and ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, displayed together in a centered buttons area.

Revise the Timeline section layout/interaction to avoid the current long vertical scrolling behavior by presenting the timeline in a way that reduces vertical page length (e.g., horizontal timeline/track) while keeping all existing timeline events (date, title, 1-line description) and maintaining a tasteful reveal/entrance animation.

Fix the Proposal section so the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button never overlaps the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button at any time (including when the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button becomes absolute and starts moving). Ensure the moving ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button stays fully visible within its container and does not cover the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button.
